comment.author: 44124466908@N01
comment._content: Some articles on the march and parade in Washington, DC memory.loc.gov/ammem/awhhtml/aw01e/aw01e.html womenshistory.about.com/library/weekly/aa010118a.htm This photo was taken on February 10, 1913 (see top of photo) Here's another photo of this www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2658868292/ There are photos from the parade in DC including www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2615544645/ There was also a Pathe newsreel on this (Suffragettes from many states holdings banners showing their state name and a banner `Ye Votes for Women Pilgrimage from New York City to Washington D.C. 1913') ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/title/592106

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: The women are holding banners representing states that already have women's suffrage in 1913--the idea of women's suffrage marching across the US, from the free and open West to the stodgy East, was a common theme in US suffrage demonstrations....
